main event: A B-29 flying weather reconnaissance sighted an unidentified object over the Simiiju area on 29 August 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as 6 or 7 feet long, cigar shaped, and orange-red in color., The object was traveling at an estimated speed of 600-800 MPH., It was first seen at the 2 o'clock position and disappeared at the 11 o'clock position., The sighting lasted for approximately 1 minute before the object disappeared at an altitude of 150 feet above the airplane's altitude., All crew members on board, with a combined experience of 3,400 hours combat missions, concurred on the sighting.
witness description: Crew members of the B-29, including Pilot-Commander, Pilot, Navigator, B.N.G, and Sight Scanner
